top_categories.workout_context: 8,189ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Race-pace efforts that mimic SBT GRVL's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before June.
SBT GRVL's famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 108 miles.
76ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At mile 60 of 108, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At SBT GRVL, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of SBT GRVL. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At SBT GRVL, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 108 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
8,189ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 8,189ft of climbing on famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for SBT GRVL’s 108 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: SBT GRVL with 8,189ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at SBT GRVL requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality gravel roads through working ranches, aspen groves, and sage-studded hills at high altitude to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on VO2max, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 108 miles of famous 'champagne gravel' - smooth, high-quality gravel roads through working ranches, aspen groves, and sage-studded hills at high altitude in Steamboat Springs, Colorado.
